signal

Class Tone

  • java.lang.Object
    • signal.Tone
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sine, Square, Triangle

    public abstract class Tone
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class to generate audio Signals. Outputs of this class are File Name, Byte Array of generated signal and Audio signals format
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ehsan-Ul-Haq
    See Also:
    #createTone(), #getFilename(), #getBuf(), # getAudioFormat()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createTone()
      Method to create audio frequency signal.
      abstract void generateSignal(int sample, int waveSelection)
      Method to generate audio signal on the basis of user selection and store the float values of generated signal in a buffer array of type float
      javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
      It returns the format of audio .wav file
      byte[] getBuf()
      It is a buffer array with byte values of generated audio signal
      java.lang.String getFilename()
      It returns a string with file name of .wav file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createTone

        public void createTone()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Method to create audio frequency signal. It calls the generate signal method in Sine, Triangle or Square class depending upon the the user selection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        #generateSignal()

      • generateSignal

        public abstract void generateSignal(int sample,
                                    int waveSelection)
        Method to generate audio signal on the basis of user selection and store the float values of generated signal in a buffer array of type float
        Parameters:
        sample - is the sample number of audio signal
        waveSelection - is the user selection for Frequency 1, 2 or Sum

      • getFilename

        public java.lang.String getFilename()
        It returns a string with file name of .wav file
        Returns:
        file name of .wav file

      • getBuf

        public byte[] getBuf()
        It is a buffer array with byte values of generated audio signal
        Returns:
        returns the Byte array of generated signal

      • getAudioFormat

        public javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
        It returns the format of audio .wav file
        Returns:
        audio format of generated signal
